---
title: Alphabet will pay $22 million to settle President Trump’s YouTube lawsuit
date: '2025-09-29'
excerpt: >-

  in a class action lawsuit brought against the company over the suspension...

<p>Alphabet<a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:The Wall Street Journal;elmt:;cpos:1;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=2f007401-3eaa-4237-b69b-54ccbe125502&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=b7c15d7b-ec90-4794-998d-cb174af8e7df&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=The+Wall+Street+Journal&amp;linkText=will+pay&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAATsg8tFaYXhKekjDhT2PwOHky6N7ga2TUTdLAs0Fouq9&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Fus-news%2Flaw%2Fyoutube-to-pay-24-5-million-to-settle-lawsuit-brought-by-trump-808f6823%3Fgaa_at%3Deafs%26gaa_n%3DASWzDAiNtjNIo6U14mOQ-NTb5_FeYbVngWxNVUQw5gQXyqC7jTjboldNXRz7Usso-A0%253D%26gaa_ts%3D68db0d73%26gaa_sig%3DMryChiHrDH3GMtnZ-Hxw4d-XtkFNSRwTUittuy8Vy7tgjWf6GLeOaxYASCOW0h9ZVQNRYerM3YX3De5ZLNzgMg%253D%253D" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.wsj.com/us-news/law/youtube-to-pay-24-5-million-to-settle-lawsuit-brought-by-trump-808f6823?gaa_at=eafs&amp;gaa_n=ASWzDAiNtjNIo6U14mOQ-NTb5_FeYbVngWxNVUQw5gQXyqC7jTjboldNXRz7Usso-A0%3D&amp;gaa_ts=68db0d73&amp;gaa_sig=MryChiHrDH3GMtnZ-Hxw4d-XtkFNSRwTUittuy8Vy7tgjWf6GLeOaxYASCOW0h9ZVQNRYerM3YX3De5ZLNzgMg%3D%3D"> <ins>will pay</ins></a> President Donald Trump $22 million as part of a settlement in a class action lawsuit brought against the company over the suspension of various YouTube accounts following the January 6 riot at the US capital, as first reported by the<a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:The Wall Street Journal;elmt:;cpos:2;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=2f007401-3eaa-4237-b69b-54ccbe125502&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=b7c15d7b-ec90-4794-998d-cb174af8e7df&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=The+Wall+Street+Journal&amp;linkText=Wall+Street+Journal&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAATsg8tFaYXhKekjDhT2PwOHky6N7ga2TUTdLAs0Fouq9&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Fus-news%2Flaw%2Fyoutube-to-pay-24-5-million-to-settle-lawsuit-brought-by-trump-808f6823%3Fgaa_at%3Deafs%26gaa_n%3DASWzDAiNtjNIo6U14mOQ-NTb5_FeYbVngWxNVUQw5gQXyqC7jTjboldNXRz7Usso-A0%253D%26gaa_ts%3D68db0d73%26gaa_sig%3DMryChiHrDH3GMtnZ-Hxw4d-XtkFNSRwTUittuy8Vy7tgjWf6GLeOaxYASCOW0h9ZVQNRYerM3YX3De5ZLNzgMg%253D%253D" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.wsj.com/us-news/law/youtube-to-pay-24-5-million-to-settle-lawsuit-brought-by-trump-808f6823?gaa_at=eafs&amp;gaa_n=ASWzDAiNtjNIo6U14mOQ-NTb5_FeYbVngWxNVUQw5gQXyqC7jTjboldNXRz7Usso-A0%3D&amp;gaa_ts=68db0d73&amp;gaa_sig=MryChiHrDH3GMtnZ-Hxw4d-XtkFNSRwTUittuy8Vy7tgjWf6GLeOaxYASCOW0h9ZVQNRYerM3YX3De5ZLNzgMg%3D%3D"> <em><ins>Wall Street Journal</ins></em></a>. The suit includes other plaintiffs whose YouTube channels were banned that will split an additional $2.5 million in settlement payouts.</p>
<p>Trump<a data-i13n="cpos:3;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/trump-sues-twitter-facebook-google-152555050.html"> <ins>filed the suit</ins></a> in 2021, alongside lawsuits against Twitter and Facebook over similar suspensions, claiming they infringed on his first amendment rights. Twitter, now known as X since its acquisition and rebrand by Elon Musk, paid President Trump roughly $10 million to settle that suit. Meta also<a data-i13n="cpos:4;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/social-media/meta-will-pay-25-million-to-settle-a-lawsuit-with-donald-trump-over-his-2021-facebook-suspension-234046291.html"> <ins>settled its suit</ins></a> with the president over his suspension from the platform for $25 million earlier this year.</p>
<span id="end-legacy-contents"></span><p>This settlement comes shortly after Alphabet<a data-i13n="cpos:5;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/big-tech/youtube-may-reinstate-channels-banned-for-spreading-covid-and-election-misinformation-190257602.html"> <ins>wrote a letter</ins></a> to the House Judiciary Committee lambasting government pressure to moderate content on its platforms. The company also shared that YouTube would be offering a path to reinstatement for accounts previously banned for COVID-19 or election integrity related misinformation.</p>
<p>The settlement from Alphabet will be paid to the Trust for the National Mall, a nonprofit partner of the National Park Service, and will be earmarked for construction of the<a data-i13n="cpos:6;pos:1" href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefings-statements/2025/07/the-white-house-announces-white-house-ballroom-construction-to-begin/"> <ins>ballroom</ins></a> that President Trump is building at The White House. The monies from the Meta settlement were similarly earmarked.</p>
<p>This summer Paramount, parent company of CBS,<a data-i13n="cpos:7;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/entertainment/paramount-pays-trump-16-million-to-settle-harris-lawsuit-124505902.html"> <ins>settled a lawsuit</ins></a> brought by the president over claims that the network intended to &quot;confuse, deceive and mislead the public&quot; by editing an interview with Kamala Harris. The media company paid $16 million to settle the president’s suit. Three weeks later the<a data-i13n="cpos:8;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/entertainment/fcc-approves-skydances-8-billion-paramount-acquisition-032028104.html"> <ins>FCC approved</ins></a> the $8 billion acquisition of Paramount by Skydance.</p>This article originally appeared on Engadget at https://www.engadget.com/big-tech/alphabet-will-pay-22-million-to-settle-president-trumps-youtube-lawsuit-234611643.html?src=rss
